Detailed Description

A color definition abstraction.

This class is an abstraction of a color definition, which can be loaded from XML file. It represents a single definition (for example the color definition of a string).

The XML syntax of the color definition is inspired by the syntax highlight teh kate project (http://kate.kde.org/, http://www.kate-editor.org/)

The syntax of the color definition is simple

  • a node with tag name of itemData
  • all the properties of that node are rendered as properties for this color definition

For example: 

 > itemData defStyleNum="dsNormal" name="Normal" color="#000000" selColor="ffffff" background="ffffff"  bold="0" italic="0" / <

This class can also be converted to a QTextCharFormat on demand.

See also:
QsvColorDefFactory

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

QsvColorDef::QsvColorDef (   ) 
 

default constructor

Construct a default color definition. By default no color not background is defined which makes this color definition "neutral".

QsvColorDef::QsvColorDef (  QDomNode  node  ) 
 

construct a color definition from a node

Parameters:
node the DOM node from which to load the definitions
Construct a default color definitino from an XML dom node. The definition of the colors will be read by calling load( QDomNode )

See also:
load( QDomNode )

Member Function Documentation

QColor QsvColorDef::getBackground (   ) 
 

the background color of this color definition

Returns:
a QColor represnting the background color
Use this function to retrievethe QColor representation of this color definition. If no color defined, it will return black (by constructing an empthy QColor).

QColor QsvColorDef::getColor (   ) 
 

the font color of this color definition

Returns:
a QColor represnting the forground color
Use this function to retrieve the QColor representation of this color definition. If no color defined, it will return black (by constructing an empthy QColor)

QColor QsvColorDef::getSelColor (   ) 
 

the font color for selected text of this color definition

Returns:
a QColor represnting the selection forground color
Use this function to retrievethe QColor representation of this color definition. If no color defined, it will return black (by constructing an empthy QColor).

QString QsvColorDef::getStyleNum (   ) 
 

return the style number definition

Returns:
a string represnting the style number definition
Each color definition should have an attribute called "defStyleNum" which represents the style of this color. This way you can collect all the color definitions into a factory and styart quering it for a specific role using this attribute.

See also:
QsvColorDefFactory

bool QsvColorDef::isBold (   ) 
 

this property represents if the color definition is "bold"

Returns:
true if the color definition is bold
Will return true if the loaded value of the attribute bold by the load( QDomNode ) is "true" "yes" or "1" (not case sensitive). All other values will return false.

bool QsvColorDef::isItalic (   ) 
 

this property represents if the color definition is "italic"

Returns:
true if the color definition is italic
Will return true if the loaded value of the attribute italic by the load( QDomNode ) is "true" "yes" or "1" (not case sensitive). All other values will return false.

bool QsvColorDef::isUnderline (   ) 
 

this property represents if the color definition is "underline"

Returns:
true if the color definition is underline
Will return true if the loaded value of the attribute underline by the load( QDomNode ) is "true" "yes" or "1" (not case sensitive). All other values will return false.

bool QsvColorDef::load (  QDomNode  node  ) 
 

load the definition of the colors from a node

Parameters:
node the DOM node from which to load the definitions
Returns:
true on succes, false on ay error
Load the definition of this color from a DOM node. An example of the node which is loaded is:

 > itemData defStyleNum="dsNormal" name="Normal" color="#000000" selColor="ffffff" background="ffffff"  bold="0" italic="0" / <

This syntax is similar to the kate syntax definitions code, and initialy inspired by it.

bool QsvColorDef::save (  QDomNode  node  ) 
 

save the definition of the colors into a node

Parameters:
node the DOM node to store the colors definitions
Returns:
true on succes, false on ay error
Currently not implemented and returns false.

In future it will stire the definitions of this color into the node.

QTextCharFormat QsvColorDef::toCharFormat (   ) 
 

convert this color definition to a QTextCharFormat

Returns:
a QTextCharFormat which contains the same defintino as this class.
This function converts this class into a QTextCharFormat which can be used in QSyntaxHighlighter class for example.
